results.title: [Melbourne Zoological Gardens]
results.brief_description: An observational documentary of the Melbourne Zoo. The film features the Zoo as a visitor attraction focusing on the interests of children. Children’s verbal observations form a large part of this otherwise non-narrated film. Various animals are shown in their enclosures and the film takes us on the Zoo train tour. Photography: Graeme Jackson and Philip Cordingley
results.description: An observational documentary of the Melbourne Zoo. The film features the Zoo as a visitor attraction focusing on the interests of children. results.title: [Maya Deren Compilation]
results.brief_description: A collection of films of Maya Deren. 1. “Private Life of a Cat” An animal’s outlook on life, narrated by Maya Deren, but directed by Alexander Hammid; 2. “Study in Choreography” A dancer moves across a land scape; 3. “Very Eye of Night” Dancers performing in negative; 4. “Meditation on Violence” A young Oriental man performs shadowboxing; 5. “Ritual in Transfigured Time” Movements of the dancers are merged with a variety of photographic effects.

results.title: [Matthew Flinders: bi-centennial celebrations]
results.brief_description: Shows footage of the bicentennial celebrations in Great Britain of the explorer Matthew Flinders (born 1774-1814), including the “Explorer’s Window” at Lincoln Cathedral, several exhibits and an art exhibition detailing his life, and finally a presentation of a Memorial Stone by Sir Murray Porter to Lincolnshire to commemorate Matthew Flinders’ birthday. Commentary by John Hyfield. NB: No title or credits and film ends abruptly

results.title: [Maryvale Paper Mill]
results.brief_description:
Untitled silent film with occasional intertitles.
Of historical value this film shows Sir Herbert Gupp(?) with Rotarians at the Maryvale Paper Mill on 20 February 1941.
The Mill was built in 1937 at a cost of 400,000 pounds. Also shows homes of the workmen and staff.
No credits available.

results.title: [Maori days]
results.brief_description: Shows New Zealand flax being harvested; baskets being made; cloaks being made from Kiwi feathers; dancing; geysers and hot mud baths; shell fish.

results.title: [Malvern swimming club]
results.brief_description: Shows young children learning to swim at the Malvern Swimming Club in Melbourne and includes scenes of trials, races and presentation of prizes from the 8th Annual Swimming Championship Carnival program held in February 1961.

results.title: [Luka Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
An aeroplane comes to life out of the Australian stamp, “Australia circling the earth” and proceeds to fly to London.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Long fliv the king]
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Hal Roach and Hal Roach Studios
results.brief_description: Featuring Oliver Hardy in a bit role (before he teamed up with Stan Laurel) this silent film tells the story of a princess who upon learning the news that her father has died is given 24 hours to find a husband in order for her to become queen. Cast includes Charley Chase and Martha Sleeper. NB: Title. credits and last few feet of film missing.
